metadata.Name: GECTOR-QE
metadata.Description: A Japanese Quality Estimation dataset for Grammatical Error Correction. It contains 2,000 sentences from the Lang-8 corpus, outputs from a GEC model, and HTER scores annotated by humans.
metadata.Paper Title: Construction of a Quality Estimation Dataset for Automatic Evaluation of Japanese Grammatical Error Correction
metadata.Venue Title: Proceedings of the Language Resources and Evaluation Conference (LREC 2022)
metadata.Abstract: Grammatical Error Correction (GEC) is a task that involves automatically correcting grammatical errors in text written by language learners. Although GEC systems have been evaluated using metrics such as F0.5-score and GLEU, these metrics require gold-standard reference sentences, which are costly to create. To address this problem, Quality Estimation (QE) has been proposed as an alternative evaluation method that does not require reference sentences. However, there is no publicly available dataset for Japanese GEC-QE. In this study, we construct a Japanese GEC-QE dataset. We first collected sentences from a Japanese GEC corpus and then used them as input to a state-of-the-art neural GEC model to obtain the model’s outputs. Finally, we annotated the model’s outputs with Human-targeted Translation Error Rate (HTER) labels. The constructed dataset is publicly available.
